question: Which nation houses "Wouri Estuary"?
explanation: Wouri Estuary is also known as Cameroon Estuary. It is a tidal estuary. It is an interface for the several rivers of Cameroon that drain its waters to Bight of Biafra, Gulf of Guinea. This estuary is famous for its mangrove forests. It lies to the east of Mount Cameroon. It is home to Cameroon Ghost Shrimp, from which the country got its name.
